Do you want to modify the grad, or stop it altogether? Here are two possibilities:
For stopping:

c = a + b
d = c.detach()
# all code remains the same

For modifying:

val = a + b
# These two lines are 0-cost ops, but they do insert nodes in the graph,
# so c and d can have independent hooks
c = val.view_as(val)
d = val.view_as(val) 
# all code remains the same

body:
Do you want to modify the grad, or stop it altogether? Here are two possibilities:
For stopping:
```python
c = a + b
d = c.detach()
# all code remains the same
```
For modifying:
```python
val = a + b
# These two lines are 0-cost ops, but they do insert nodes in the graph,
# so c and d can have independent hooks
c = val.view_as(val)
d = val.view_as(val) 
# all code remains the same
```
